title: Trading Platform Latency Spike
description:
During peak trading hours (14:00-17:00 UTC), our trading platform experienced severe latency issues. API response times increased from the normal 50-100ms to over 5 seconds. Users reported inability to execute trades, view real-time prices, and access their portfolios.

The issue was first detected by our monitoring system when error rates exceeded 5% threshold. Initial investigation pointed to database connection issues, but further analysis revealed a memory leak in the price aggregation service that was introduced in the previous deployment.

timeline.event: Monitoring alerts triggered for high API latency
On-call engineer acknowledged and began investigation
Database team confirmed DB is healthy
Memory leak identified in price aggregation service
Decision made to rollback to previous version
Rollback completed, latency returning to normal

resolution: Rolled back the price aggregation service to the previous stable version. The memory leak was caused by an unbounded cache that grew indefinitely under high load. A fix was developed and tested before being deployed to production 2 days later.
additionalContext: This was our first P1 incident in 3 months. The deployment had passed all automated tests but the memory leak only manifested under sustained high load which wasn't adequately covered in our load testing scenarios.
